reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Emergency WASH response in 3 LGAs of Borno State - Maiduguri, Jere and Dikwa

description.narrative:
CIDAR is currently implementing Emergency WASH interventions for vulnerable and affected population in 18 IDP Camps and 13 Host communities in four LGAs of Brono state in partnership with UNICEF Nigeria for a period of 12 months (12-Sep-2019 to 11-Sep-2020): Jere LGA–6 IDP Camps and 6 Host MMC LGA–5 IDP camps and 4 Host Dikwa LGA-6 IDP Camps and 5 Host Konduga LGA–1 IDP Camp and 4 Host The major activities of UNICEF support Project of USD 1,727,026 (includes UNICEF WASH Supply as well) are: -Operation and maintenance of 51 solar water facilities -OampM of 24 hand-pump water facilities -OampM of 20 Solar hybrid water facilities for extra hours during off-sun -Upgrade of 6 hand-pumps to Hybrid Solar water facilities with hand-pumps -Daily chlorination and free residual chlorine monitoring (FRC) of 679 water points (SMBHs, HPBHs, MBHs, Underground reservoirs receiving water frpm Urban Water Treatment Plan or centralized mega-borehole) covering total population of 311,400 in 13 Wards of Jere and MMC LGAs -Repair/Rehabilitation of 50 Blocks of latrines in Custom House-1 Camp -OampM of 118 Blocks of sanitation facilities in Teachers Village Camp to cover daily cleaning, repair/maintenance of sanitation facilities by beneficiaries through WASHCOMs -Intensive Hygiene Promotion in focal Camps covering house-to-house visits, focused group discussions, hand-washing at critical times, safe handling of water and food, etc. The UNICEF funded proposal was approved prior to WASH Sector’s ‘One Camp – One Actor’ Rationalization processes, which in fact, a brilliant idea as far as accountability of WASH Actors and effective resource utilization are concern. This camp rationalization has created some gaps in almost every Camp and host community where one or two (max.) WASH partners will implement Complete WASH Package. CIDAR’s case is not different from other partners and through proposed proposal for funding request to Nigeria Humanitarian Fund (NHF), we meet the gaps filled in WASH Sector allocated/proposed Camps. Proposed Project will reach additional 201,995 people through following WASH interventions in those Camps and host communities where CIDAR is implementing similar activities with another donor support: A.Providing additional 430.6m3 potable water for drinking and other domestic use per day from Solar motorised boreholes and Handpumps in:
A-1 Upgrade of 6 broken-down Handpump boreholes to Hybrid Solar motorized Boreholes with Hand-pump (174 m3 water per day): a.Dikwa Host Community –1 upgrade -27m3 per day b.MMC Host Communities –2 upgrade –60m3 per day c.Jere Host Community –3 upgrade - 87m3 per day
A-2 Rehabilitation and Operation amp Maintenance of 45 broken down handpump boreholes in Focal Camps and Host Communities (256.6 m3 water per day): a.Motor Park –4 HPBHs –22.8 m3 (5.7m3/HPBH/day) b.Dikwa Host Community –4 HPBHs –22.8m3 c.Twenty Housing Estate-1 HPBHs –5.7m3 d.1,000 Housing –3 HPBHs –17.1m3 e.Jere Host Community –17 HPBHs –97m3 f.MMC Host Community –16 HPBHs –91.2m3
B.Construction of 10 blocks of sanitation facilities in WASH Sector allocated rationalised camps in Dikwa- a.Twenty Housing Estate – 1,116 PiN - 9 Blocks (4L+2B) proposed b.Shehu Musta-II – 1,116 PiN – 1 Block proposed
C.Rehabilitation, repair, cleaning and maintenance of 90 blocks of toilets in allocated camps to CIDAR: a.Muna Garage El-Badawi Camp-30 Blocks b.Teachers Village Camp –24 Blocks c.Motor Park Camp –10 Blocks d.Shehu Musta-II Camp –16 Blocks e.Twenty Housing Estate Camp –10
D.Operation, maintenance and daily cleaning of 142 blocks of sanitation facility by engaging beneficiary committees in following Camps: a.Teachers Village Camp –24 Blocks b.Motor Park Camp –10 Blocks c.Shehu Musta-II Camp –16 Blocks d.Twenty Housing Estate Camp – 10 e.Custom House-2 Camp –82 Blocks
E. Daily Chlorination and FRC monitoring of 200 community water collection points in addition to 679 water points.
